Tasks.Task: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway
Tasks.Task Description: Create a virtual network and virtual network gateway if you haven't already. This is a prerequisite for setting up ExpressRoute.

Tasks.Task: Set up the connection between the virtual network gateway and ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Use the Terraform script or PowerShell command to configure the connection between the virtual network gateway and your ExpressRoute circuit.
Verify your network configuration by selecting 'Get ARP Records' and 'Get route table' under the ExpressRoute Private peering page in the Azure portal.
Enable ExpressRoute Fast Path to access your Azure Large Instances servers from anywhere, including Azure VMs and on-premises.

Tasks.Task: Check learned routes from Azure Large Instances
Tasks.Task Description: Look at the Effective Routes table of one of your VMs to see the learned routes from Azure Large Instances.
Set up volume groups for your Azure Large Instances solution based on your system requirements.

Tasks.Task: Set up storage snapshot, backup, and data offload
Tasks.Task Description: Set up a storage snapshot, backup, and data offload after all data-intensive work is complete.
If you don't see your Azure Large Instances deployment under your subscription, register the resource provider with your subscription.
Create and modify an ExpressRoute circuit as needed for your project.
Create and modify the peering configuration for your ExpressRoute circuit.

Tasks.Task: Link a VNet to an ExpressRoute circuit
Tasks.Task Description: Link a virtual network (VNet) to an ExpressRoute circuit to enable private connectivity.
Customize your metrics and create a Connection Monitor to track the performance and reliability of your ExpressRoute connection.
Evaluate the network design to ensure connectivity between all resources, considering mechanisms like Azure ExpressRoute, public Internet, or private endpoints.
Assess the network security requirements for client tools to access analytical compute and storage, considering options like peered network, private endpoint, or other.
Evaluate regulatory requirements for your data, such as PCI or HIPAA, and ensure your security group has certified Azure for this data.
Set up on-premises access via a Site-to-site VPN connection or via ExpressRoute, ensuring it is in place before starting the project.
Review Azure networking components like network security groups (NSGs) for proper connectivity and data movement.
Consider integration with private DNS zones for your network design.
Enable accelerated networking with all VMs connecting to Azure Large Instances.
Evaluate data protection requirements such as in-transit encryption, encryption at rest, and data discovery and classification.
